text:
Page 3
Served as consultant to National Association of Radio and Television
Broadcasters in establishing minimum standards for radio
instruction at the college and university level
Producer of two motion pictures for Great Northern Railroad
through Empire Photosound, Inc., St. Paul, Minn. (1936-1937)
Technical consultant on production for three motion pictures
for the National Music Camp, Interlochen, Michigan (1952)
Script writer for radio scriuts used in observance of American
Education Week by National Education Association (1950-1951)
Lectures at Universities of Minnesota* Oklahoma, Illinois,
Houston, Iowa, at New York, Syracuse, Boston, Baylor,
Northwestern and Emory Universities, at Colorado State
Teachers and Texas Western Colleges, and others.
Supervised the production of more than 9000 broadcasts from
Radio House at the University of Texas (1946-1952)
Supervised the production of nineteen telecasts from University
of Texas (1950-1952)
References:
Mr. Kenneth M. Hance, General Manager, Station KSTP, St. Paul,
Minnesota
Miss Judith C. Waller, Director of Public Affairs, National
Broadcasting Co., Merchandise Mart, Chicago, Illinois
Dr, E. W. Doty, Dean, College of Fine Arts, University of
Texas, Austin, Texas
Dr. Joseph E. Maddy, President, National Music Camp, 303 South
State St., Ann Arbor, Michigan
Dr. Franklin G. Dunham, Chief, Radio Division, U.S. Office of
Education, Washington 25, D.C.
Mrs, Dorothy Lewis, Coordinator of U.S, Station Relations,
Radio Division, United Nations, New York City, N.Y,
Mrs. Dorothy Gordon, Director, Youth Forum, New York Times,
Times Square, New York City, N. Y.
Mr, Ralph Steetie, Executive Director, Joint Committee on

Washington 6, D.C,

Cooperative Broadcasting Council, Symphony Hall, Boston 15,
Massachusetts
Mr. William S. Yale, President, Empire Photosound, Inc.,
490 Snelling Avenue N., St. Paul, Minnesota

Texas, Austin, Texas
Dr. Archie Jones, Department of Music, University of Texas,
Austin, Texas
